item.title: Identifying histology-based subtypes on the basis of cell-to-cell interactions
item.description: The precise and robust measurement of a broad range of biomolecules in the tissue architecture context opens up new opportunities for improving our understanding of disease, monitoring therapeutic response, and the development of high-dimensional clinical tests. In this study we apply multiplex IF staining platform (Perkin-Elmer Vectra) on a diverse set of cancer cases. These include samples of different tissue types from Genomics England and a set of colorectal polyps from the S:CORT (Stratification in Colorectal Cancer) cohort.

item.title: Multiplex Immune Cell Profiling in Colorectal Cancer
